entries.title: Amazon's cloud business reports 20% growth in fourth quarter, missing estimates
entries.description: Amazon Web Services is still growing faster than its parent company, but the unit is seeing a deceleration as businesses reel in spending.

entries.title: Ferrari's profits jump 13% in 2022, supercar maker expects an even better year in 2023
entries.description: Ferrari guided to an even stronger year in 2023, boosted by its high-priced sports cars like the Daytona SP3 and the upcoming Purosangue SUV.

entries.title: Starbucks is about to report earnings. Here's what to expect
entries.description: Shares of Starbucks have risen more than 12% over the last year, fueled by optimism around China's reopening and the persistence of U.S. coffee habits.

entries.title: Bitcoin briefly rises above $24,000, extending its new year rally amid a broader gain in tech stocks
entries.description: The jump coincided with a broader rally in stocks led by the Nasdaq as well as a drop in U.S. Treasury yields and the U.S. Dollar Currency Index.

entries.title: Opinion: Why Beijing is cheering on the U.S. debt ceiling fight
entries.description: Continued brinksmanship and extremism over the debt ceiling is only serving to undercut a key element of U.S. strength.

entries.title: Ford is set to report results after the bell. Here's what Wall Street expects
entries.description: The automotive industry's earnings and forecasts are being closely watched by Wall Street for any signs of weakening consumer demand.

entries.title: Apple reports earnings after the bell Thursday
entries.description: Analysts expect the iPhone maker to post its first year-over-year revenue decline since 2019.

entries.title: Amazon to report quarterly results after market close
entries.description: Analysts will be watching to see if Amazon CEO Andy Jassy has made progress on reeling in expenses after the company announced 18,000 layoffs.

entries.title: Alphabet set to report fourth-quarter results after the close
entries.description: Google's core business is mired in a period of slow growth as businesses reel in ad spending.

entries.title: Charlie Munger says the U.S. should follow in China's footsteps and ban cryptocurrencies
entries.description: "A cryptocurrency is not a currency, not a commodity, and not a security," the 99-year-old Munger said in an op-ed published in the WSJ Wednesday evening.

entries.title: Meta shares rocket 25%, on pace for the best day in a decade
entries.description: Meta Platforms saw a slew of analyst upgrades as shares rose nearly 20% off the backs of a better-than-anticipated earnings report and optimistic commentary.

entries.title: Bank of England chief tempers talk of a pause or pivot in rate hikes
entries.description: The Bank of England governor on Thursday talked down expectations that it is readying to pause or pivot rate hikes, noting that there is still some way to go in taming inflation.

entries.title: An 81-year-old brain doctor's 7 'hard rules' for keeping your memory 'sharp as a whip'
entries.description: Neuroscientist Richard Restak has spent decades studying how to enhance brain health and memory. Here's how he stays mentally sharp at 81 years old.

entries.title: European Central Bank raises rates by 50 basis points, pledges further hike in March
entries.description: The European Central Bank on Thursday confirmed expectations of a 50 basis point interest rate increase, taking its key rate to 2.5%.

entries.title: ChatGPT introduced AI to the masses and it's already affecting us
entries.description: Since OpenAI released it in November 2022, millions of people have been using the AI chatbot for things like fixing coding errors and writing papers.

entries.title: Bank of England hikes rates by 50 basis points, now sees 'much shallower' recession than feared
entries.description: The Bank of England on Thursday hiked interest rates by 50 basis points.

entries.title: Iran accuses Israel of launching drone attack on weapons facility
entries.description: Israel has said it is ready to strike targets in Iran if diplomacy fails to rein in Iran's nuclear program or missile development.

entries.title: Twitter will start charging developers for API access as Elon Musk seeks to improve monetization
entries.description: Twitter will start charging developers to get access to its API, a vital tool on the platform that powers popular services like TweetDelete and software bots.

entries.title: More than 13,000 Nigerian residents take Shell to court over oil spills
entries.description: A combined 13,652 claims are asking Shell to take responsibility for the loss of their livelihoods.

entries.title: Adani losses top $100 billion in wake of Hindenburg Research report
entries.description: Sell-off losses have been accruing since the Jan. 24 publication of a critical report from U.S. short seller Hindenburg Research.

entries.title: Oil giant Shell posts highest-ever annual profit of $40 billion
entries.description: The extraordinary scale of the industry's earnings has renewed criticism and sparked calls for a Big Oil windfall profit tax.

entries.title: The U.S. Fed's smaller rate hike brings dollar strength closer to its end
entries.description: The U.S. dollar index continued to slump on Thursday as the Federal Reserve opted for a smaller interest rate hike of 25 basis points.

entries.title: 'Greenwashing' is a good thing, according to one renewable energy tycoon
entries.description: "It's everywhere ... But you know, I take it as a good thing," Ecotricity founder Dale Vince tells CNBC.

entries.title: Biden's IRA has left Europe blind-sided. And playing catchup could lead to 2 big mistakes
entries.description: The European Union is working against the clock to create a program to rival President Joe Biden's unprecedented climate subsidies.

entries.title: Deutsche Bank smashes profit expectations in fourth quarter as higher interest rates bolster revenue
entries.description: Deutsche Bank surpassed profit expectations in the fourth quarter, reporting 1.8 billion euro ( $1.98 billion ) of net profit attributable to shareholders, as higher interest rates boosted revenues.

entries.title: Hong Kong services to rebound as China reopens, but UBP says sector is coming from 'fragile situation'
entries.description: However, its economist warned that the sector will be "going from a very fragile situation," given its contraction in every single quarter of 2022.

entries.title: A potential U.S. ban on investment in Chinese tech could hurt these sectors
entries.description: A ban on U.S. investment in Chinese tech could drive up market volatility — but some sectors may escape untouched, Bank of America analysts said.

entries.title: A travel insider explains how people who hate cruising — can learn to enjoy it
entries.description: Private shore excursions let cruisers make their own plans, choose their restaurants and spend the day with a local guide — without a cruise ship bus in sight.

entries.title: Gautam Adani calls off $2.5 billion equity sale as regulatory concerns grow
entries.description: Shares of Adani Enterprise were routed in the aftermath of a report from short-seller Hindenburg Research
